casebody.data:
ERB v. CALIFORNIA. No. 23,

Mise.

Decided March 13, 1967. William A. Dougherty for petitioner. Thomas C. Lynch, Attorney General of California, William E. James, Assistant Attorney General, and David B. Stanton, Deputy Attorney General, for respondent. Per Curiam.

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment is vacated and the casé remanded for further consideration in light of Chapman v. California, ante, p. 18.

Mr. Justice Stewart would grant certiorari and reverse the judgment for the reasons stated in his opinion concurring in the result in Chapman v. California, ante, at 42.
